title: Petition so if you load into a game as a level 30 and forget masteries you use a default set by riot
body:
Had my client bug out a lot of times and wouldn't save masteries, then there are times I've just plain forgot.

Having no masteries is a massive disadvantage, something simple that could eliminate a large problem :)

(The default set would be made for that champion by Riot, kind of like recommended items :) )

replies.body:
You could literally start a petition on change.org if you really are passionate about it.

I do like your idea, however it has its flaws. How does the game decide whether a person put the wrong masteries on or not? What if the player is going something stupid in normals for fun? What about champions who can be built in different ways? For instance, Shaco can be built ad and ap (sort of) and both ways require VERY different masteries.

I mean you *could* solve this with by offering the player of making a preset mastery page and being able to link it to a champion like item sets I guess, since riot isn't great at making preset item pages and it would be a fair amount of work and would bother players who like to customise their playstyle extensively. I mean depending on what I need I have like 8 different item set pages and 4 different mastery pages for shaco (rip after the rework, going to stop playing him) depending on how I need to play him and what item spikes and adaptive options I need (AD 1shot crit assassin, AD damage Armour Pen, AD lifesteal atkspd, AD duelist, TitanicTank, Splitpush, AP Jungle, AP TopLane, AP Support) so I always have a quick way to pick my item build options and optimise the shopping experience. I'm sad shaco will get reworked before I can use him in ranked tho. {{item:3070}}

>How does the game decide whether a person put the wrong masteries on or not? 

He means when you accidently have no masteries set at all (Those people you usually see with no keystone)
